sections.title: You can not register for this service at this time
sections.description: As you expect to produce less than 2,500 litres of biofuels or other fuel substitutes in the next 12 months, you are an exempt producer and do not need to register at this time.

fields.infoText:
You must come back and register if you exceed 2,500 litres in a 12 month period, or if you later expect to exceed this amount within the next 12
months. 

As an exempt producer there are simple records that you are required to  keep about the fuel you supply or use. You can find details about this on GOV.UK in [Excise Notice 179e: biofuels and other fuel substitutes](https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/excise-notice-179e-biofuels-and-other-fuel-substitutes/excise-notice-179e-biofuels-and-other-fuel-substitutes#exempt-producers-users).

fields.label: When is Biofuel Duty payable?
fields.infoText:
Duty is payable from when biofuels or other fuel substitutes are first, sent out from your premises, set aside, or used as a motor fuel. 

A biofuel or other fuel substitute is 'set aside' when the decision has been made to use it as a motor fuel. For example, when its container is labeled as a motor fuel.

Where can I find out how to calculate duty on biofuels?
fields.infoText:
To find out how to calculate duty follow the steps below.
1. Open a new tab or window.
2. Go to GOV.UK.
3. Search for 'UK Trade Tariff: excise duties, reliefs, drawbacks and allowances'.
